summary.p: The STANDARD mode provides the latest recommended default values that should be safe to run in most scenarios
Note that the default values vended from this mode might change as best practices may evolve. As a result, it is encouraged to perform tests when upgrading the SDK
The IN_REGION mode builds on the standard mode and includes optimization tailored for applications which call AWS services from within the same AWS region
Note that the default values vended from this mode might change as best practices may evolve. As a result, it is encouraged to perform tests when upgrading the SDK
The CROSS_REGION mode builds on the standard mode and includes optimization tailored for applications which call AWS services in a different region
Note that the default values vended from this mode might change as best practices may evolve. As a result, it is encouraged to perform tests when upgrading the SDK
The MOBILE mode builds on the standard mode and includes optimization tailored for mobile applications
Note that the default values vended from this mode might change as best practices may evolve. As a result, it is encouraged to perform tests when upgrading the SDK
The AUTO mode is an experimental mode that builds on the standard mode. The SDK will attempt to discover the execution environment to determine the appropriate settings automatically.

Note that the auto detection is heuristics-based and does not guarantee 100% accuracy. STANDARD mode will be used if the execution environment cannot be determined. The auto detection might query EC2 Instance Metadata service, which might introduce latency. Therefore we recommend choosing an explicit defaults_mode instead if startup latency is critical to your application
The LEGACY mode provides default settings that vary per SDK and were used prior to establishment of defaults_mode

member.name: T:Amazon.MailManager.Internal.AmazonMailManagerEndpointProvider
member.summary: Amazon MailManager endpoint provider. Resolves endpoint for given set of MailManagerEndpointParameters. Can throw AmazonClientException if endpoint resolution is unsuccessful.

member.summary: Resolve endpoint for MailManagerEndpointParameters

member.name: T:Amazon.MailManager.Internal.AmazonMailManagerEndpointResolver
member.summary: Amazon MailManager endpoint resolver. Custom PipelineHandler responsible for resolving endpoint and setting authentication parameters for MailManager service requests. Collects values for MailManagerEndpointParameters and then tries to resolve endpoint by calling ResolveEndpoint method on GlobalEndpoints.Provider if present, otherwise uses MailManagerEndpointProvider. Responsible for setting authentication and http headers provided by resolved endpoint.

member.name: T:Amazon.MailManager.Model.DeleteArchiveRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the DeleteArchive operation. Initiates deletion of an email archive. This changes the archive state to pending deletion. In this state, no new emails can be added, and existing archived emails become inaccessible (search, export, download). The archive and all of its contents will be permanently deleted 30 days after entering the pending deletion state, regardless of the configured retention period.

member.name: P:Amazon.MailManager.Model.DeleteArchiveRequest.ArchiveId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ArchiveId.
The identifier of the archive to delete.

member.name: T:Amazon.MailManager.Model.DeleteArchiveResponse
member.summary:
The response indicating if the archive deletion was successfully initiated.
On success, returns an HTTP 200 status code. On failure, returns an error message.

member.summary: This action replaces the email envelope recipients with the given list of recipients. The message contents and headers are unaffected by this action, only the envelope recipients are updated.

member.name: T:Amazon.MailManager.Model.Rule
member.summary: A rule contains conditions, "unless conditions" and actions. For each envelope recipient of an email, if all conditions match and none of the "unless conditions" match, then all of the actions are executed sequentially. If no conditions are provided, the rule always applies and the actions are implicitly executed. If only "unless conditions" are provided, the rule applies if the email does not match the evaluation of the "unless conditions".

member.name: P:Amazon.MailManager.Model.Rule.Actions
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Actions.
The list of actions to execute when the conditions match the incoming email, and none of the "unless conditions" match.

member.name: P:Amazon.MailManager.Model.Rule.Conditions
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Conditions.
The conditions of this rule. All conditions must match the email for the actions to be executed. An empty list of conditions means that all emails match, but are still subject to any "unless conditions"

member.name: P:Amazon.MailManager.Model.Rule.Name
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Name.
The user-friendly name of the rule.

member.name: P:Amazon.MailManager.Model.Rule.Unless
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Unless.
The "unless conditions" of this rule. None of the conditions can match the email for the actions to be executed. If any of these conditions do match the email, then the actions are not executed.

member.summary:

The condition applies to a string expression passed in this field.

member.name: P:Amazon.MailManager.Model.RuleCondition.VerdictExpression
member.summary:

The condition applies to a verdict expression passed in this field.

member.name: T:Amazon.MailManager.Model.RuleDmarcExpression
member.summary: A DMARC policy expression. The condition matches if the given DMARC policy matches that of the incoming email.

member.name: P:Amazon.MailManager.Model.RuleDmarcExpression.Operator
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Operator.
The operator to apply to the DMARC policy of the incoming email.

member.name: P:Amazon.MailManager.Model.RuleDmarcExpression.Values
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Values.
The values to use for the given DMARC policy operator. For the operator EQUALS, if multiple values are given, they are evaluated as an OR. That is, if any of the given values match, the condition is deemed to match. For the operator NOT_EQUALS, if multiple values are given, they are evaluated as an AND. That is, only if the email's DMARC policy is not equal to any of the given values, then the condition is deemed to match.

member.name: T:Amazon.MailManager.Model.RuleIpExpression
member.summary: An IP address expression matching certain IP addresses within a given range of IP addresses.

member.name: P:Amazon.MailManager.Model.RuleIpExpression.Evaluate
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Evaluate.
The IP address to evaluate in this condition.

member.name: P:Amazon.MailManager.Model.RuleIpExpression.Operator
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Operator.
The operator to evaluate the IP address.

member.name: P:Amazon.MailManager.Model.RuleIpExpression.Values
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Values.
The IP CIDR blocks in format "x.y.z.w/n" (eg 10.0.0.0/8) to match with the email's IP address. For the operator CIDR_MATCHES, if multiple values are given, they are evaluated as an OR. That is, if the IP address is contained within any of the given CIDR ranges, the condition is deemed to match. For NOT_CIDR_MATCHES, if multiple CIDR ranges are given, the condition is deemed to match if the IP address is not contained in any of the given CIDR ranges.

member.name: T:Amazon.MailManager.Model.RuleIpToEvaluate
member.summary: The IP address to evaluate for this condition.

member.name: P:Amazon.MailManager.Model.RuleIpToEvaluate.Attribute
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Attribute.
The attribute of the email to evaluate.

member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Value.
The value to evaluate in a numeric condition expression.

member.summary: The number to evaluate in a numeric condition expression.

An email attribute that is used as the number to evaluate.

member.name: P:Amazon.MailManager.Model.RuleSet.RuleSetName
member.summary:

A user-friendly name for the rule set.

member.name: T:Amazon.MailManager.Model.RuleStringExpression
member.summary: A string expression is evaluated against strings or substrings of the email.

member.name: P:Amazon.MailManager.Model.RuleStringExpression.Evaluate
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Evaluate.
The string to evaluate in a string condition expression.

member.name: P:Amazon.MailManager.Model.RuleStringExpression.Operator
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Operator.
The matching operator for a string condition expression.

member.name: P:Amazon.MailManager.Model.RuleStringExpression.Values
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Values.
The string(s) to be evaluated in a string condition expression. For all operators, except for NOT_EQUALS, if multiple values are given, the values are processed as an OR. That is, if any of the values match the email's string using the given operator, the condition is deemed to match. However, for NOT_EQUALS, the condition is only deemed to match if none of the given strings match the email's string.

member.name: T:Amazon.MailManager.Model.RuleStringToEvaluate
member.summary: The string to evaluate in a string condition expression.

member.name: P:Amazon.MailManager.Model.RuleStringToEvaluate.Attribute
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Attribute.
The email attribute to evaluate in a string condition expression.

member.name: P:Amazon.MailManager.Model.RuleStringToEvaluate.MimeHeaderAttribute
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MimeHeaderAttribute.
The email MIME X-Header attribute to evaluate in a string condition expression.

member.name: T:Amazon.MailManager.Model.RuleVerdictExpression
member.summary: A verdict expression is evaluated against verdicts of the email.

member.name: P:Amazon.MailManager.Model.RuleVerdictExpression.Evaluate
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Evaluate.
The verdict to evaluate in a verdict condition expression.

member.name: P:Amazon.MailManager.Model.RuleVerdictExpression.Operator
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Operator.
The matching operator for a verdict condition expression.

member.name: P:Amazon.MailManager.Model.RuleVerdictExpression.Values
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Values.
The values to match with the email's verdict using the given operator. For the EQUALS operator, if multiple values are given, the condition is deemed to match if any of the given verdicts match that of the email. For the NOT_EQUALS operator, if multiple values are given, the condition is deemed to match of none of the given verdicts match the verdict of the email.

member.name: T:Amazon.MailManager.Model.RuleVerdictToEvaluate

member.name: T:Amazon.MailManager.AmazonMailManagerClient
member.summary:
Implementation for accessing MailManager
Amazon SES Mail Manager API
The Amazon SES Mail Manager API contains operations and data types that comprise the Mail Manager feature of Amazon Simple Email Service (SES).
Mail Manager is a set of Amazon SES email gateway features designed to help you strengthen your organization's email infrastructure, simplify email workflow management, and streamline email compliance control. To learn more, see the Mail Manager chapter in the Amazon SES Developer Guide.

member.name: M:Amazon.MailManager.AmazonMailManagerClient.#ctor
member.summary:
Constructs AmazonMailManagerClient with the credentials loaded from the application's default configuration, and if unsuccessful from the Instance Profile service on an EC2 instance.
Example App.config with credentials set.
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?> <configuration> <appSettings> <add key="AWSProfileName" value="AWS Default"/> </appSettings> </configuration>

member.name: M:Amazon.MailManager.AmazonMailManagerClient.DeleteArchiveAsync(Amazon.MailManager.Model.DeleteArchiveRequest,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Initiates deletion of an email archive. This changes the archive state to pending deletion. In this state, no new emails can be added, and existing archived emails become inaccessible (search, export, download). The archive and all of its contents will be permanently deleted 30 days after entering the pending deletion state, regardless of the configured retention period.

member.name: T:Amazon.MailManager.IAmazonMailManager
member.summary:
Interface for accessing MailManager
Amazon SES Mail Manager API
The Amazon SES Mail Manager API contains operations and data types that comprise the Mail Manager feature of Amazon Simple Email Service (SES).
Mail Manager is a set of Amazon SES email gateway features designed to help you strengthen your organization's email infrastructure, simplify email workflow management, and streamline email compliance control. To learn more, see the Mail Manager chapter in the Amazon SES Developer Guide.

member.name: M:Amazon.MailManager.IAmazonMailManager.DeleteArchiveAsync(Amazon.MailManager.Model.DeleteArchiveRequest,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Initiates deletion of an email archive. This changes the archive state to pending deletion. In this state, no new emails can be added, and existing archived emails become inaccessible (search, export, download). The archive and all of its contents will be permanently deleted 30 days after entering the pending deletion state, regardless of the configured retention period.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the DeleteArchive service method.
